I wore it paired with a skirt but felt too casual with just jeans. Very comfy. Size down, I’m typically an XL, but the L fit me more than we’ll, back has a lot of stretch.
I loved this and kind of want to keep it.

Truly was obsessed with this blouse. It was comfy, cute, flattering. A little longer than portrayed in pictures. I got compliments every time I wore it. Dress it up, dress it down. Wear it with jeans, leggings, shorts... really is a great, fun piece with an even prettier print! Highly recommend!

I was drawn to the pattern and stripes. The medium fit well but probably wouldn’t work well on a large bust. The only thing I didn’t like was the high neck—I found it a bit tight. This looked great by itself or with a blazer over it.

links_reviews_title: Pretty print, material isn't as high as expected
links_reviews_text: The top was pretty but the material was so thin it felt cheap.

The pattern is fantastic and the material feels high quality. The back is a thin sweater and the front is a thicker satin. The difference in material means the back is heavier than the front, so I felt like it was always pulling the shirt backwards and against my neck. The front unfortunately wrinkles almost immediately upon putting it on. I did wear it several times though because its such a fun print.
Very lightweight sweatshirt. I wore it with jeans and it was a cute look.
I received many compliments... if that’s your thing. This top is cool and different and fits well.
Probably wore it like 10 times in a month. Would have bought it to keep if it wasn't dry clean only.

links_reviews_title: A step up from a basic pullover
links_reviews_text: I like this top a lot. The front fabric has no stretch so it a tiny bit tight across the chest but not to the point I would size up. I wore this to work with skinny dress pants and with jeans. The neckline is a little higher than I'd like but it was still comfortable. I might buy this top.
overall fit is great, does run a little long
This is pretty and easy to wear! I wore it mostly with jeans out. It’s light enough to wear under a jacket or blazer to work.

Looked great with a blazer and the fit was true-to-size. However, if you're planning on leaning against anything (such as when you're driving), be prepared for almost unbearable itchiness! It's not that bad when you're standing and the fabric (really the silver thread) doesn't rub, but I wouldn't wear it again.
Got the 2X and the 3X. Neither were just right.
Color palate, fabric and detail die for! If you’re large chested (DD/E) size up! It fit me but I was in between sizes on this one.

I really wanted to get this top, my size wasn’t available so I went a size up which really was too big. Had I received this in my size m sure I would have worn it a bunch. The material is nice, soft and cottony so would breath well on a hot day.
Cute top and fun to wear.
The shirt fit a bit large, and it was difficult to keep on my shoulders. I didn't end up wearing this item. It was cute in the picture, but just wasn't my style in person.

links_reviews_title: Path to Innocence 70's Vibe all the way
links_reviews_text: I felt like I could go to Woodstock in this shirt in a good way. Busty girls this is a very forgiving top. Loved
I liked this shirt. The square-ness was not flattering on me but I like the colors and quality.

I love the square neckline of the top. The colors are vibrant, and it's a lovely flowy fit. The only downside was that the front gapped open when leaning over so just be careful lol. I'll definitely be renting it again!

Beautiful material/floral pattern, but a weird fit. If you like a ruffled bottom, this will work well, but I don't find the cut to be particularly flattering. If you have hips, it will make you look 'hippier'.

The fabric of this piece is breezy, but papery. It's hard to describe, but not thin cottony fabric. If you're particular about texture this one may not work for you. Other than the interesting fabric, the print and embroidery is gorgeous and I loved it! It is roomy, boxy and I will size down next time. It's not short and boxy, though.
this top was awkwardly too small. wanted to like it, but the shoulders and arms were weirdly tight and it just didn't fit me right.
Loved this blouse! Really feminine and fun. It is a little big around the neck but otherwise a beautiful addition for work or play.
Didn’t like how it looked on Would be cute on some one else
This top is beautiful, but huge. I think the cut made it look like a maternity top.

I love the different textures and colors in this top. It is very feminine. I wish the sleeves weren't so long, but overall I really enjoyed wearing. I thought about keeping, but wasn't totally in love.

links_reviews_title: This shirt was large like a tent.
links_reviews_text: I wore this to work and it was big and a bit unflattering. I would have sized down.
This would only fit someone with no chest.

This top is beautiful, but the two things that made it not a 5 star review were the very itchy embroidery at the top neckline and the extra flouncy cut. It is very voluminous. I wish the embroidered portion was lined.
It’s really itchy. My bad for thinking I could layer this under an oversized cardigan, it kinda bunched up over my bust. A little too flowy for my taste, looked like a maternity top.
I should have sized down at least one if not 2 sizes. It’s very voluminous! The fabric and details are gorgeous, just watch your size choice!
I liked the colors and print but the material was stiff and scratchy and I really wasn’t a fan of the style. I didn’t end up wearing this.
Cute prints but not as form fitting as desired
The fabric and detailing are lovely, and it's a unique and noticeable design. The boxy fit may not flatter every shape.
This was very pretty but just didn't work for me. The neck was too high and it was sort of tight through the chest and big everywhere else. It was just sort of an odd fit overall.
Love the romantic print and easy fit. It felt a little scratchy, but worth the discomfort for the compliments.
Luv the tiers but to lose in top
Great top! Not as mint green as the picture leads you to believe. Slightly darker. Still love it!
This shirt was super comfortable and the color was perfect for St. Patrick's day! It does run big but its meant to be flowy!

This shirt was very comfortable & perfect for the spring weather. Being 23 weeks pregnant I didn't mind that it was a little on the large side. Had I not been pregnant it would not have been my first choice. Color is also more of a brighter green, not the light neutral shade shown in the photo.
Loved the color, fabric and brand. Lightweight, easy to dress up, down or later. Should have gone with a 2 X. Bell tiers were extra wide.
Really cute top! Got lots of compliments! Considered keeping it!

This is the perfect rental tee. I liked it because it was loose and flowy and loved the mint color. It wasn't quite as mint as I was expecting (was a little more dusty). I am typically between M and L and went with M, which fit fine but was the slightest bit snug in the shoulders. It was a neither here nor there top and glad that I rented it and wore it, but glad I didn't purchase it at the store.

This top was so pretty. For tops I vary between an XL and 1X, and this one I should have sized down to an XL. This top is very generously cut, but flouncy and very cute. I wore this with the skinniest pants I own to offset the volume of the top and pointed flats.

I never know with Maeve styles. I can try a large and it's way too tight, but I picked XL in this top and it was a bit too big. I was able to make it work though and I got lots of compliments. It's a soft high quality cotton, long enough to wear over jeans on a casual Friday at work. If I reserve again though, I'd probably get a large.
This t-shirt is thick and well-made, but looked a little frumpy on me.
Nicely made t-shirt. Thick fabric. Nice cut. Just didn't wow me.
This T-shirt was really cute and drapey and a step up from your average t-shirt so that was really nice

I thought I would like this shirt more than I did. I love the colors in it - the blue flowers are perfect with denim blue jeans. It has a band on the bottom that is easily partially tucked in without looking to blousy or bunched up. But I didn't give it more stars because it was just so boxy looking on me - perhaps because I have very wide shoulders. So even though there wasn't anything wrong with it, I just didn't like how it looked on me.

links_reviews_title: Pretty style - colors were less vibrant than I hoped
links_reviews_text: This shirt was so beautiful and vibrant in the photos - it was a more muted pallette in person. I liked wearing it but wouldn't hang on to it.

Initially tried 'L' but it was oversized, so I then rented and purchased the 'M'. I have worn this with green velour pants/jacket in cool weather, pink jeans in spring weather and light purple lounge pants during quarantine. I love its versatility for weather and color matching!

links_reviews_title: Soft and flattering even though boxy
links_reviews_text: Looked great with jeans or work Slacks - very versatile
This shirt is colorful and fun. A little oversized in the style, but not too large. Got a lot of compliments on it!
After seeing this on display at Anthro, I hurried home and added it to my Nuuly. It was everything I hoped, and made me feel that Spring was near. It is big, so size down.

links_reviews_title: Can I Live in it Forever?
links_reviews_text: This skirt was such a winner. It's feminine, it's got a little bit of shine, and feels forgiving for every body type. I found myself reaching for it several times beyond what I got it for. It was a good length, and I found that I preferred to wear it at my natural hips with a simple black spaghetti strap top and bohemian jewelry. It really fit my energy-healer California girl personality while still feeling up to date.

links_reviews_title: Skirt is gorgeous but was too big!
links_reviews_text: I suggest ordering down a size. The skirt is absolutely gorgeous but was too large for me at the wasit

Wore this skirt with a band t-shirt, leather belt and boots. Wish I would have taken a better picture! Saw some music, great twirling skirt! Wish I wouldn’t have gotten a 6 instead of 8, have a smaller waist and big booty so it’s a tough call. Wouldn’t say it ran big, I’m just in between. I would say, if you want and strong high waisted look, I would size down.
I tried this on at home and pranced around-love this skirt but because of the quarantine I never got to wear it anywhere. I will rent again later on. so romantic and you feel like a fairy
Cute idea, and the fit is technically spot on, but while I’m not particularly curvy, this skirt added what looked like two sizes up to my hips.

I received a lot of compliments when wearing this skirt. It was unique and very pretty. It was more sparkly in person than I thought, and it shed sparkles a bit. I needed to belt the skirt because the heavy fabric pulled the elastic down, but it was an easy fix.

this skirt is so eclectic and classic all in one. i paired it with a black cropped tshirt and black pointy toed booties and got so many compliments! It is also so so comfortable. I feel cute and dressy but also confident!

Enjoyed this tiered skirt for a small venue concert. Paired it with a cotton t style bodysuit and the fringed levi's black jacket. It does run big but has stretch so it would be hard to have a bad fit. The only negative is that there is glitter on the material that sheds itself a bit.
Was bummed this didn’t fit but overall so cute just ran a bit large
I was afraid that it may be “too much” but it was great! I wish that I would have taken pictures! I was really sad to send it back!

This skirt is gorg! Loved the pattern and the tiered shape. I felt like a princess wearing it. I dressed it down with doc martins and a crop hoodie. I wanted it to sit above my waist but because the waistband wasn’t so tight, I kept having to pull it up to avoid it touching the floor. Although it naturally fit at my hips, I definitely would have preferred to size down for a high waisted fit. The second time I wore it, I paired with heeled booties so the length wasn’t an issue. Could also be dressed up for an event, very elegant.
I literally couldn't have worn this more in the month I had it. I received so many compliments and I was so obsessed. Seriously considered not paying rent so I could keep this forever.
Beautiful skirt but too big. I am usually a size 12 and the size 10 kept slipping down.

This skirt is so beautiful. I rented my usual size and it was just too big/loose in the waist. As a result, it sort of drifted down my body as the day passed and I almost "pantsed" myself multiple times. Definitely would rent again in a smaller size.

Sparkly and beautifully patterned skirt! Love it! Only qualm is that the waist cinches lightly, not tightly, so since the dress has lots of ruffles it tends to sag due to the weight. Totally would size down to solve this problem or belt it! I belted it and it was so cute!
I got so many compliments on this skirt. It's frilly and fun but should've sized down because it kept slipping. Other than that, I would've kept it.

This skirt runs both larger and longer than I expected. I am 5’9” and even I kept stepping on it. Plus, because it has a stretchy waist band, I would often end up almost pantsing (skirting?) myself in public if I stepped on the hem, which happened more than once. Other than that issue, it’s a beautiful skirt that I would definitely rent again in a smaller size.
Really pretty skirt. I've received several compliments. The waist is elastic so it's comfy but it fell a lot. Maybe size down.
The metallic thread was shedding just from touching it.
This skirt was perfect in every way!!
I rented the US size 10 and it was very large. The waist kept sagging down. Super fun statement skirt otherwise. I paired it with a black leather jacket and slouchy suede boots!

links_reviews_title: Really pretty and versatile... with a few caveats
links_reviews_text: This skirt is SO pretty! I got compliments all day when I wore it to work. The fabric is super lightweight so it can be worn in any season - I wore it over leggings to work to stay warm in the winter. There are metallic threads throughout that dress the skirt up. I could definitely imagine wearing it to a wedding or event with a silky cami and heels. Caveat #1: the metallic threads have a tendency to shed... like EVERYWHERE. I left a trail of gold dust behind me everywhere I went. Caveat #2: I am usually between a 4 and 6 so I took a chance on this one and ordered a 4. The waist is elastic all the way around but it's not very strong elastic so it easily slips down to your hips. I recommend sizing down for a snug fit that's actually at your waist. Or you can belt it (that's what I did) to keep it in place!
Like everyone said, size up. The waist is insanely small, and the legs are so wide, but they were also very short. I’m 5’7-8
Thought these ran "big" but maybe the other reviewers meant wide? These fit everywhere but the waist. I would swap out the size, especially with summer coming because they look very luxe.
Fits on the waist but is HUGE on the legs. Couldn't wear it out looked so strange, nothing like the pic on me 🤷‍♀️
Definitely size up in these pants. They were too small so I never got the chance to wear, but also didn't seem to be the most flattering fit as the rise is really high.
Sadly this didn’t fit my mommy tummy.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful and fit great but see-through
links_reviews_text: These pants are SO cute and fit great. I dressed them up for a networking event but they looked great styled with the blue Puff Sleeve Mock Neck Sweater also on here. My two issues: they wrinkled really easy - just sitting in the car they'd get wrinkled, and they were very see-through - I'm talking you could see my nude color underwear through them.

links_reviews_title: Fits around waist but the legs are very wide
links_reviews_text: The legs are much wider than the waist
These run huge. Great fabric and cute belt, but hard to make work.
This was a fun, quality sweater. Wasn’t my favorite fit though, I’m petite and this seemed a tad frumpy rather than intentionally oversized. Would recommend sizing down if you’re more petite.
fit great, got tons of compliments
This was way too big for me, I normally wear a medium but putting this on made me look like I was wearing a heavy wool throw blanket with no shape It also shed a lot.
This really didn't do much for me. It was soft but a little boxy. I tried it on and returned it without wearing it out.
Nice and warm, but very close to a thick rug like sweater. Small was way too big, and I'm normally a s/m in everything.

This was larger than I expected. The neckline was wide enough that you could almost always see my bra straps and the stitching is very heavy. I would have preferred a smaller size (which doesn't exist) for my frame.

I really did like this sweater, but definitely recommend downsizing. I got my normal size and still made it work, but I had to roll up the sleeves quite a bit and it make my shoulders look a little bit square. Got lots of compliments and love the fringe on the bottom!

This sweater had cute potential but it was super big in the side area just under the armpits. I never would have gotten a small but I think that would be more my size in this top. I would recommend sizing down.
Was cute and fit but fit awkwardly and almost too big around the neckline, while then being cropped and shorter. Not idea
The fit was very weird. Too boxy in the shoulders/chest and the sleeves were too long. Didn’t look flattering at all and went back in the box.
really cute and fits fairly well. I am glad I went down a size, because it is definitely big. Soft material and very stylish/warm
Cute and comfy! Got a few compliments at work too :)

I loved this sweater, wore it to work all the time. It was great to just throw on. It is a little boxy and its not unflattering but not flattering either. Just a standard baggie sweater. Very comfortable.

Ended up being unseasonably warm this month so didn't get as much wear out of this sweater as I had hoped. It is thick and will keep you warm despite being cropped! The neckline made my shoulders look a little broad.

I didn't end up wearing this.. It was bulkier then I was expecting. Overall very nice quality as all the clothes on Nuuly are! I wouldn't rent it unless you're going to be somewhere cold and need to be bundled up.
I love oversized tops but this was HUGE! It was super heavy, an awkward length and immediately went back in my Nuuly bag until time to return.
So cute and I know it’s meant to be chunky, but I would probably order a size XS when I usually order a medium.
Fit as expected, a little oversized and sleeves a little long but overall feels great!

I ordered a size down and am glad I did. It was still baggy and flowy but in a good intentional way. The fabric of this has an unexpected beautiful sheen. I enjoyed the looks I had- tucked the front into high-waisted denim with loafers. Chic.

Sueded fabric, perfect color for a redhead, oversized, but flow enough to show your shape, soft and touchable, low-cut enough to make things interesting and to show off a cool lariat necklace. Buying this one.

Loved this top! I would've purchased if it weren't for a few thread pulls at the hem, so I might just rent again and see if I get luckier next time. I ordered a large, my usual size in most things, and it was reaaallly billowy and big. I loved it, but just keep that in mind when ordering. Great color, highly recommend!
I loved the way this shirt felt— it was very comfortable but ran slightly large. I wore it with leggings and a tank underneath

I liked the feel of the fabric and thought the luster and color were really beautiful. The shirt was way too oversized though, and the neckline fell really low on me, almost too low to wear to work. It also wrinkled quickly and made me feel like I was wearing a tent.
So beautiful and so chic!!
Loved this shirt. Even though it ran large it fell on all the right spots and was super flattering. Loved the material and color. Lots of compliments !
This shirt is so fun, flattering and all around great! Just enough shimmer to look refined but also so easy and flowy! I wore with a leather skirt and booties and I got so many compliments!
cute oversized shirt, but the material wrinkled so much
so many compliments on this. great quality and flattering fit.

Loved this top the color is stunning, the fabric feels like heaven and its perfectly oversized without looking frumpy. The only issues I had with it are that the fabric wrinkles very very easily and the buttons were very big and noticeable so I mostly wore it work/during the day - didn't transition to night as I had hoped.

The fabric of this top is so luscious. Can me dressed up or dressed down! I'm normally a small or medium and the small still felt a little big, it's definitely an over sized fit. Sleeve detail was also a nice touch!
a bit of a hi-low fit, seemed like it was much longer in the back. luxurious fabric and fun color. easy to wear with anything wore to work with slacks and out with leggings and boots.
Wore to Work, brunch, and everywhere. Got a lot of compliments on the color and fabric, mainly because people said it matched my hair color (brunette). Looks very fancy casual
Ran bigger than I’d like, and the material was very wrinkly and difficult to wear

I love this blouse and decided to keep it. It fit well, and the material is so soft and suave against my skin. It feels like you can dress it up a pair of jeans easily by just adding this top! Definitely recommended
Really cute and fits fairly well. If it was a size smaller I would have bought it. Soft material- pretty thin. Nice for warm weather but with a breeze
This top is gorgeous. My only complaint is that it holds static, so it clung to me a little more than I liked. It’s also prone to wrinkling, but I still liked it!
Great color and style! I needed to wear a cami underneath as this is very low cut and my bra would have been exposed throughout the day.
I picked this out hoping it'd be a comfy loose fit but the upper arms and shoulder area was pretty tight. I love the color and fabric and might rent again and just size up!
Honestly it was a little tight in my upper arms/arm pit area and the v-neck line is really deep. Fabric wrinkles very easily. Just didn't really love the way it looked on me.

I loved this top. I'm normally a L/XL and got a Medium based on the reviews. It was a little tight around the shoulders, but I still wore it a lot. The fabric is so soft and cool. I got a lot of compliments. The deep V was sometimes questionably low (my bra peeked out a few times).
I absolutely loved this top! The fabric is soft and looks expensive. Perfect for work or a fun night out.

The color of this top was so fun! I did only get to wear it once because the cut of the neckline was too low for my body type. I kept having to pull up the shirt all day because of how low it fit me. The sleeves were so cute and the color was perfect. If the neckline wasn't so low I would have rated this shirt higher. I'm also a size 34A and I felt uncomfortable with how low the cut hit my chest area.

This shirt looks cute on! It is an oversized fit and I loved the v-neck and puffy sleeves. The color is gorgeous. However, I was very disappointed with the fabric. I steamed it before an event and by the time I got there it was a wrinkly MESS. I was very embarrassed to wear it to an event where I would be seeing so many people. It wrinkles so quickly and I couldn't find any way to prevent it.

I don't like the color green...but I loved this top. The sleeves are really billowy and dramatic - which is so fun! It definitely runs a little big and the fit isn't for everyone, but if you're tall (like me!) you'll love it.

The SLEEVES. Are. Gorgeous. I loved wearing this so I could look at the fabric and how it changed in different lighting scenarios. The only reason I took away a star is it's super low cut, so couldn't really wear it to work. The description does say "Deep V" so that is a tiny bit unfair of me.
It was a cool shirt, definitely more blousy and shiny than I expected.

Cute top, but just know the sleeves look like something out of Shakespeare. I’m typically and M, or L, and based on their Website, I went with an L (since there were no reviews here). Wish I went with an M.

This jumpsuit is a great balance of utilitarian and feminine, and I loved the color! I am short, so the v of the neck was very deep and the pants were a bit long, but I just rolled the pant legs a couple times and taped the neckline a bit. Highly recommend!
This jumpsuit is SO good. It’s hip, modern, but can be dressed up or down. Fits TTS (and made my butt look so good). Get this. Now. You’re welcome.

links_reviews_title: Was excited to try on but then disappointed with the fit
links_reviews_text: The material is very soft and I loved the color!... But after trying to slip into it it didn't fit. I was sad because mediums usually fit fine but this jumpsuit was very tight.
Fits TTS or small on the legs/waist and is HUGE on the top.

links_reviews_title: Cute but too tight in legs
links_reviews_text: This would be cute, but it ran small for me and was smaller in the legs than the rest of the jumpsuit in my opinion!
Do it! Cute comfortable jumpsuit that was easy to dress up for work and for a date.

links_reviews_title: Cute but not good for petites
links_reviews_text: As stated previous, this jumpsuit does not work well if you're on the shorter side. It sadly was a bit saggy on me, but would probably be super cute on someone maybe 2 inches taller.

links_reviews_title: may be better suited for someone taller
links_reviews_text: Just got this in my first Nuuly. It's the cutest jumpsuit in a gorgeous color and fit me perfectly in some areas, but might be better suited for someone taller. The waist/crotch area fell super low on me and just looked saggy. Wanted to love it, but can't wear it due to the fit.

HORRIBLE. The top portion was gigantic. When I pulled the jumpsuit up to the correct position, there was about six inches of extra material in the top (front and back). I am admittedly tall and long-legged, but this was ridiculous. I also think the pockets were backwards.
Who doesn't need a floor length duster to throw over literally everything, everyday while stuck home? This thing is massive (the XS on a small-medium body) but a comfy cozy addition.
Very Robe like but loved the material and its was so comfy. Wore it alot during WFH!
Really cute and comfortable. But, was really long on my 5'4" body. Basically touched the ground so I wore it more as a robe than a fashion piece.

Loved this too, but didn't wear. Got this one for the beach trip as well which we didn't go due to lock down. But I could see this being great to throw on at the beach. Long, flowy, soft and runs large. Nice weight and felt good,
This duster was the perfect weight while I was working from home during quarantine. Highly recommend!
I just love it . So me . It grows as you wear but I like it long . Cute sleeve detail to throw on over leggings and a tank . Super cute !
Wore over yoga clothes to work, and made my workout gear into an outfit. Also, adorable with monotone outfit.
Wore it with a black dress and boots.
I really need some more, long cardigans and had hopes for this but it was just too big and swimmy. Also the knit was too thick. I wanted it to be thinner and slimmer.
Very cute but so long! The model must be an Amazon woman because this sweater touched the ground if I was wearing flats... and I’m not that short.
Ran a bit big but I love it ! Super long and grows as you wear it , it seems . Lots of compliments

This is great, exactly my kind of light, flowing summer cardigan and with bell sleeves to add interest. I’m very tall and the length was perfect. The bad news is that it ran really big, even for an oversize item. The good news is that I will be buying a size medium for the first time in ages if I can get it in my next Nuuly.
This duster felt like wearing a robe in public, in the most fabulous way possible. You know who else wears robes in public? Queens.

This was an unexpectedly fun piece to wear - it definitely was long on me (I'm 5'4") and dragged on the ground a tiny bit. But I got many compliments and lots of friends encouraged me to purchase it. Loved wearing it!

links_reviews_title: Very cute when paired with white jeans
links_reviews_text: This Cardigan looks very cute when paired with the right things. I wore it once with white jeans and it actually looked adorable.

This looked so cute in the picture but it was completely overpowering on me. I ordered a medium and probably needed an extra small. The fabric is lightweight and sort of flowy. Sleeve detailing is cute as is the raw hem but I think height is the key to being able to wear this successfully.
Big overall

links_reviews_title: Runs large and heavy, but cute!
links_reviews_text: Cute over a tight dress or shorts and a crop, etc. Really need something under that's fitted to not get swallowed in the fabric. Heavier fabric than expected. Size down!!! I am 5'5", 135 ish and got an XS and it's still oversized

This falls so beautifully and it moves with the wind when you walk. It is glamorous and comfortable. I dressed it up with black slacks and a black top and dressed it down with a white tee and jeans and STILL felt glam!! So luxurious and comfy. Perfect duster cardigan for all of the occasions, including snuggling on the couch!
Bold, awesome pattern, but weird material and design. The black band starts at a weird place and as a busy woman, this just didn't work for me at all.

Big Cat print was perfect! The proportions of this top are weird. It’s almost cropped but the bottom band is wide. Looked cute with overalls! Inside of fabric is not comfortable- kind of scratchy and was too warm for the current weather.
this top is SO CUTE. my best friend said "oh you HAVE to buy that one!" ...it isn't warm, even though it is "quilted," but it is super cute.
I really liked this top. Paired with high waist pink pants and wore this outfit all the time. And this top is pretty warm.
This top was so cute! It does run true to size. I got large because I was worried about it being cropped and too tight. I could have got a medium. Super cute, it's quilted and cozy.
I liked this too but would say it was tighter than expected and the fabric didn’t feel very breathable. I love the pattern and wore it with a pair of black denim.
Received so many compliments on this sweater. It is pretty short but doesn't sit/fit awkwardly.
Love this sweater. Is cropped and a little warm for a 70s day but the look and pattern are fab.

links_reviews_title: really, really in like with it.
links_reviews_text: I considered buying this one, because I got complimented on it a number of times...but it is on the smaller side (I assume intentionally) and it doesn't breathe AT ALL, which is problematic for someone who sweats easily. It's a great pattern and unique top, though. Worth borrowing.

I am obsessed with this coat. Not only is it super cute, it is so heavy. I live in Chicago and I wore it all of February. The hood is great - stays up and keeps you warm so no hat required. The inner fur part and the hood zip off so will work great in the spring too!

Loved the look of this jacket but know that the colors are brighter in person (green and red). Almost too bright for me personally given the contrast of the two. You can completely remove the hood's faux fur AND the soft red faux lining which is cool, but I kept it on because the jacket's a bit boring without (and I didn't love the green color especially on its own). The hood is fairly heavy with all the fur elements but it didn't pose an issue for me. Fit TTS, loved the waist cinch detail, all around comfy!
Very warm, but very thick, shapeless and frumpy.

Loved this coat and received so many compliments wearing it. The green jacket is like a twill, so it doesn’t necessarily look like a winter jacket, but that fur entirely lines the inside, so it was extremely warm for February in Illinois. The fur is removable, tho I didn’t try that (since it wasn’t necessary) and it has black stars in the dark red fur, which I couldn’t tell from the picture. I am short and the sleeves were the right length on me, so I could see that being a problem for a taller person, and the waist clinchers weren’t very easy to use since one would have to knot the string (there was no adjustable piece).
Too Big for me I was drowning in it oh well,
Love love love this cozy coat and the big hood was so striking I got lots of compliments

I really like this jacket. I have worn it to work almost everyday since I have gotten it. The sleeves are a tad bit too short but if I am wearing a sweater underneath it really doesn't bother me. Also, I have gotten lots of compliments when wearing it!
loved having this coat for a month. the inner lining actually comes out so its not always heavy. sleeves are a little short but nbd
Wore this in 0-20 degrees F and it was so warm. The only thing I didnt like about it was that it was not very flattering. I definitely could have worn a Large.

I love renting a new coat every month of a drab NYC winter! Got lots of compliments on this one. The fur is soft, the fur lining comes down to mid-hip and has cute black stars on it. I’m definitely pear shaped and the cut of the coat is pretty straight, so I preferred it unzipped. The fur zips out, so the green layer can be worn alone, but the fur layer didn’t seem to be made to be worn alone. Also beware of tricky buttons if you do separate them!

This jacket got me through some cold days and it’s a statement for sure. Wore the furry gigantic hood up with a pair of shades and felt instantly like an A lister dodging the paparazzi with Starbucks in hand. Very nice.

links_reviews_title: So many people wanted to touch the fur ;-)
links_reviews_text: Very warm! Recieved many compliments, espeically on the "fur." Great winter coat!
I've never purchased any of my Nuuly rentals because I feel like that defeats the whole purpose, but I've been wearing this DAILY and get so many compliments! Plus it keeps me warm :)

Wore this parka an insane amount! Got soooo many messages and compliments the first few times I wore it as well. Only complaint is that if you’re wearing any type of thicker shirt or sweater the arms will be tighter.

Very cute in person, the colors are awesome and the fur detail inside has the cutest black star pattern (subtle but a fun touch). The lining is also removable making it a perfect coat for layering. The hood was quite large, which is my only downside comment. It runs pretty big, I wish I got a medium but it was still cute being oversized.
Chic, fun, boujee and WARM. Seriously this has been my favorite coat of the season. So warm with a removable inside vest. Was constantly getting complements on the unique color.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous fur, shell was just okay.
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this jacket but found I just liked it the more I wore it. The inside lining and fur hood were great but the rest of the parka left something to be desired. Also not super warm. Size up if you want more of an oversized look.

Don’t be fooled by the term ‘parka’ this baby is faux fur lined and SUPER warm. True to size if wearing over sweaters, but I’d size down if not. I wore it every single day and was torn on whether to buy. Rent it if it’s cold where you are, you’ll love it!!!

This coat is cute and about a 7/10 for warmth. I live in Minnesota and it has been frigid lately, so take that into consideration. I would probably recommend this coat for temps around 30/40, because it honestly looks best when left open. The faux fur is inside and the hood lays best when unzipped. So its cute and fun to mix things up, but I would choose it for days where you're running around with it open, as it looks best that way.
honestly wasn’t expecting to love this coat as much as i do. debating on keeping it. thought i would for sure take the fur hood off.. but omg, that’s what makes this piece AN ENTIRE MOOD.

I wish I could keep this coat! It’s gorgeous and made me feel like a rockstar every time I wore it. Once when we were leaving to go out my boyfriend even joked, “Time to find out how much everyone loves your coat.” Seriously never wore it out of the house without people complimenting me or asking about it. The fit was perfect and on our coldest days it was easy to fit sweaters underneath without feeling overly bulky. Such a great style!

This is my favorite piece I've rented yet. I needed a coat for unpredictable weather as I was about to take a trip abroad, and boy am I glad I tossed this into my Nuuly at the last minute. When I was expecting rain, we got snow and hail - and this kept me warm throughout! I was worried about it not being waterproof, but it was plenty proof enough for my needs. The pockets were deep, too, so I could keep everything I needed in them (gloves, a camera, and phone!) without it distorting the fit. The snaps were perfectly placed so that I could just snap, rather than zipping, the coat, and the top one snaps in just the right spot that the faux fur is cozy against the neck, in case you forget your scarf. I love that the faux fur lining zips out if needed, though I kept it in the whole time, and the hood is so large that it doubled as a pillow on the plane for sleeping! I have very short arms, and the sleeves on this were perfect as well. I might just have to buy this one!
a fantastic coat, the arms were a bit short on me, but LOVED it
Only complaint - the hood was so heavy that it would pull the jacket backwards. somewhat uncomfortable - but overall gorgeous coat
Really loved this - also really loved that the inside fur was removable. Wore this all the time.
Fit as expected, really warm and super cute. Sleeves are a little short

Jeans were very cute! Loved the twist detail at the bottom. Sometimes, I had to keep adjusting them to make sure they were aligned. A little stretchy so after a few wears definitely a tad big. Still - so soft and comfy laid back jeans.
Nothing wrong with them, but nothing special/not my fav

I am curvy in the thighs and butt and these jeans fit perfectly! I sized up one size and the waist was stretchy and comfy. I’ve had a hard time finding high waisted jeans that aren’t uncomfortable when sitting. They fit so well I kept them!
These jeans are true to dive and very cute. The twisted seam and raw hem are a great accent on otherwise simple jeans.

These jeans fit really well and I almost kept them but I truly didn't need another pair of pants. I wore them so often, they have some stretch so they're very comfortable. I really liked the style at the bottom.
Not for shorties or curves. Defiantly has potential for the taller slender builds I think. The pair I got was particularly worn, just a heads up

links_reviews_title: Liked Not Loved (But Worth It Anyway)
links_reviews_text: I ordered a 31 in these jeans (I usually wear a 29 or 30), thinking that I’d rather them be too large than too small. When they arrived, while a little too big (especially since they stretch throughout the day, I should have went with a 29), I still fell in love with them. They were so soft and comfortable, as I have found to be the case with all Paige denim. For the most part I like to rent more trendy pieces of denim rather than purchase them, especially since it’s difficult for me to find really well-fitting, trendy jeans. I liked the color (although lighter than pictures) and the twisted/cut detail on the hem. However, these jeans were quite cropped on me (I’m 5’11 for reference), but I imagine they’d be perfect on normal-height people. Despite being imperfect for me, I still wore these jeans plenty of times throughout the month I had them and received plenty of compliments. I’d definitely recommend renting these jeans if you’re looking for a simple way to spice up your everyday uniform, just order them at your standard size 😊

Super soft and comfy jeans, that are also beyond stylish! I wore these SOOO many times that I had to purchase. They keep their shape wonderfully and hit just right at the waist. These are now my favorite go-to's.

These jeans were amazing quality! The twist seam in the front also added a bit something extra to them which I loved. So easy to dress up and down which made them a very versatile item. If you are looking for a flattering pair of skinny jeans these are them!
Versatile and comfy. I think I might try a smaller size and buy them.
Loved the cut and fit of these jeans!

These jeans are best for taller girls. I'm 5'8" and they hit me right above the foot, not above the ankle like it does on the model. They have a good amount of stretch and are comfortable to wear all day. I sized up one size and they fit great.
Amazing fit. very comfortable
Soft soft denim, very comfortable! Great high waist hit at my belly button, length hit at my ankle. A bit snug, would’ve size up. Cute cut, loved the unique front detailed seam

At 5'2", I'm used to jeans being too long on me but these were just comical. Disappointing because overall they were great. Paige jeans are always comfy, they fit my waist and thighs well, and are structured but still soft. Usually I can get away with ordering regular length jeans and rolling them, so I figured this ankle style but be slightly too long-- I was wrong. They split just over my feet and the hem touches the floor when I have them on. The twisted hem and slit make it so that you can't really cuff them. Love these on the model, but I'd skip these if you're shorter than 5'5".

These have the perfect amount of stretch. Aren’t going to get loose after a couple wears but aren’t too tight and rigid. Very comfortable but hold you in tight. Will definitely rent again. The length is great for tall girls.
I liked these! They are a lighter wash then I’m used to but I made it work for work. Cute detail at the bottom

I loved these jeans and considered buying. Super comfy, flattering and the slit is a nice touch. The slit was lower on my ankle for me than the model, which was great on a short heel, but spread outwards in flat shoes.

These fit great and are slightly special with out being out there. They are a bit higher on the waist, the length was a bit longer than I’d prefer but it’s to be expected because I and 5’2. I was still able to wear them with flats with out them touching the ground

wow okay i really love these jeans. They make my butt look SO GOOD and they’ve such a good fit. It fits in all the right places. I wore them with sneakers but also ankle boots. I love the slit at the ankle too.

Fit like a glove! The ankle detail is just enough to make these unique, but not so over the top that they can’t be worn over and over again. Other reviews mentioned them being too long - they hit just right on me. A great find if you’re on the taller size because ankle details don’t always work for us tall ladies!

I will definitely be buying these. I have long legs and have a hard time finding jeans that aren't an awkward length (regular length usually hits me too short and tall length usually is too long). These are perfect. The length opening is great for boots and sneakers. Super versatile. They hold their shape as well. Everything I've been looking for in a pair of jeans!
I hedged my bet and got a 29, normally i'm a 28, and i'm glad i did. Very flattering jeans, though!
Just when I thought I didn't need another pair of the Hoxton this cute twisted seam detail made every blouse I wore with it just a bit more edgy. Love these, bought them!
I loved these! I wore them a ton. The seam wasn’t as twisted as it looks in the picture but they were still really cute and fit great.

I am literally obsessed with these jeans. I have several pairs of $200+ jeans and these are the best pair yet. These jeans make my butt look perfect, fit the high wasted style and are sooo flattering. I got so many compliments when I wore them out on Valentine's Day! Definitely try them if you haven't yet!
These looked so cute on the model. I’m 5’4” and the ankle slit landed on my foot. Even with a heel it hit weird.
These jeans are perfect. The denim is super soft and comfy and they hold their shape. The hem is really unique. I am probably going to end up buying these ones.

So far all of the Paige jeans I have bought/rented have fit me perfectly and these were no different. I mostly wore to work or on the weekend and styled with slides, although I did wear with a chunky black boot a few times as well.
Obsessed with these jeans - if I order again some day I may buy. So well made and comfortable while also being versatile and flattering. Get em!
Loved the pants, fit me perfectly around the waist. Only thing was the length, I'm 5'1 so I forgot that I usually get petite sized jeans for the length so it was a little too long.
I loved the hem detail in these pants but they were slightly too long on me (I'm 5'8) which made the hem it in the wrong spot and look silly.
These were the softest/comfiest jeans. They did stretch out throughout the day, so if you’re between sizes — definitely size down.
Perfect wash, incredibly comfortable. Just the right amount of stretch. Loved the twisted hem detail.
Didn't work for me, too long which made the unique hem look silly. I wore them once to get my use, but felt unflattered by these. I am not a Paige denim gal.

Loved the color, fit really well everywhere. I knew with them being Paige jeans to maybe size up one, and they fit perfectly. With the bottom cut, in my opinion they looked best with open toed shoes vs. booties. I'm shorter so they ran longer past my ankle than they are on the model.

These jeans fit like a glove. I loved the high waist, lighter wash, and slit detail at the hem. I struggled a little at first with what shoes to wear with them, but found some slightly higher booties that still provided coverage in the cold weather. I ended up keeping these!

links_reviews_title: If you are petite, pass on these
links_reviews_text: Wish these came in petite. These fit more like boot cut on me instead of cropped at the ankle and I couldn’t find a shoe that worked well with them.

These are so comfortable! The wash is laid back but the twisted seam is a detail that takes these up a notch. I'm 5' 6" and these hit at my ankle (not as cropped as shown on the model since she is probably a gazillion feet tall). Also, the seam separated for me directly at the front of my ankle, which I loved but is hard to determine from the photos. Overall a huge win!
So flattering and incredibly soft! I do wish they were the tiniest bit more cropped on me, but I loved the fit regardless.They looked great dressed up or down.
These are cute, I love the front split. Sadly for me, these pants were way too long. Because of the way the split is in the front meant that I could cuff the bottoms either.
these fit well and were unique but i thought they would be cropped. At 5'7" all torso they hit the floor and werent as cute in person.

I love these jeans! They fit perfectly. I’ve work them at least a half dozen times to see if they would stretch out. They haven’t budged, they fit perfectly every time I put them on! Buying them for sure!
These jeans are great, they’re flattering and comfortable. They do run a little long—I am 5’8 and they hit right above the foot. They look cute with flats or vans.
I wanted to love these jeans. They ran true to size, but were weirdly long. I’m 5’ 7” and expected them to be cropped.

links_reviews_title: a little long for my liking!
links_reviews_text: The inseam was a bit longer than I would have liked - if I had owned these, I definitely would have trimmed an inch off the raw hem! Even at 5'8 - they cover my ankles too much for my liking!

I have a hard time finding jeans that fit well, since my hips are on the smaller side, but I have muscular legs. These fit lovely! And I think would be flattering on various body types. I do wish they were a little more high wasted. I'm happy enough and plan on buying them. The wash is good to dress up for a date night, or to keep it casual with a t-shirt.

I loved the fit of these jeans- high waisted, great stretch (but not too much!). However, on the model, these jeans almost look like they are a little cropped but when I tried them on the slit hit the top of my foot bone and so it was an awkward look at the bottom. I am 5’6!
I really enjoyed these jeans! I am usually a 27 or 28 but I know Paige runs a hair small so I ordered a 28. Really comfy and flattering. I love the high waisted factor too.

links_reviews_title: Cute denim jeans, fit like a glove
links_reviews_text: Loved the way these fit. I wore them with a striped Nuuly top and I also wore them a black top and heels. So cute!
Unfortunately the denim had no stretch. Although I could get them on, I prefer a bit relaxed fit and would size up in the future.
Jeans are always too short on me but these were perfect! They gap slightly at the top but with a belt they’re fine, i probably wouldn’t size down.
these fit amazing! make your butt look nice. they fit very true to size for me. would buy them if they weren't so expensive lol.
These are so versatile! I wore them multiple times a week while I had them. They are very soft and a little stretchy so they're really comfy. Would probably be full length on you if you're petite

I love these pants, they are beyond flattering! They are quite stretchy, so you can size down if you would like. I am between a 27/28 but I got a 28 just because I don't like things super tight and I know Paige can run a bit small.

links_reviews_title: Perfect WFH jean (if you're wearing jeans, that is)
links_reviews_text: These are so soft and comfy, they're perfect for the current WFH only environment. I was protesting jeans for as long as possible but when these arrived, I figured I'd go for it and put myself together for work. It doesn't even feel like you're wearing jeans, the denim is so soft and comfy. Only downside to their softness is that they wrinkle a bit easily - you can see the creases from sitting after only an hour of wear. I just steam them a bit and boom, all good again. I'll be wearing them as much as possible this month when I want to feel like a real human in real clothes! Oh and I sized down as I usually do with Paige.
This were pretty cute, but I didn’t love them. They weren’t as high waisted as I thought they’d be, so didn’t wear them as much. Pretty comfy!

Love these white pants. I got a 25 based on reviews but think I would stick with my normal size 26 next time. Perfect flare crop even for shorter people. I would definitely wear these a lot if I bought them. Very versatile.
So stretchy and comfy. Ordered one size down and fit perfectly!

links_reviews_title: Don’t go down a size if you’re an apple
links_reviews_text: Some reviews said go down a size. And as my regular size wasn’t available I did. Big mistake. Too tight around waist, tummy and tops of thighs. Not sure if I’ll try them again in my regular size as I didn’t like the yellowish tinge to them. They’re not white, they’re cream and a cream with a yellow shade. Plus in certain light they looked see through ...

These pants are everything you could ask for... cute, comfy, flattering and stylish. I paired it with a white shirt and felt so fashionable. My kindergarten students kept asking me why I was wearing all white, but they just don't get FASHION! I'm considering buying these pants because they are just so perfect.
These pants looked cuter in the photos than they did on me, they weren't as high-waisted as I was assuming they would be! Would be cute in the right size, however.

Super cute, loved styling these jeans. they were nice and stretchy which i find super comfortable when wearing them all day. i styled it with darker tops for a more night out look and with lighter tops for the day time/spring weather. Would definitely rent again!
Love these pants! I had them in brown as well and both are great.
My search for my perfect white jean is over! These are ideal as they are stretchy, flared, cropped and NOT see through

links_reviews_title: These are a great basic but Im not a huge fan of jeans with this much stretch. Although the stretch will be forgiving for a lot of different sizes.
links_reviews_text: These can truly go with anything. They run big so i sized down to a 26 and they were great
Chic and simple, not see through at all but lightweight. Perfect length. I’d but them for sure.
The pants are super cute, flattering, and super comfy! True to size
got so many compliments on these! many friends borrowed throughout the month and they looked great on so many different body types. highly recommend these!
It was a super cute pant, but I definitely should have sized down to the 28. This is a very wide leg pant so make sure you're expecting super wide leg when ordering!
Loved these jeans - high waisted with a cropped flare. They do stretch out so they feel a little big now. Might advise sizing down if you're in between.
These fit well but I would size down one. They’re cute with sweaters and I’ll definitely rent again when it gets warmer to wear with tanks and tees.

I have these in another color and love them, but somehow felt like I was swimming in these. I saw a photo of myself in them and was sort of appalled by how much fabric there was... not great. In theory they are fantastic - if only I had got the size right. Size WAY down in these! (They stretch so they are quite comfortable even if they are tight.)

links_reviews_title: A little big but super soft
links_reviews_text: I loved these, but they ran a little big on me so not as flattering as I had hoped. I would size down. But fabric is so soft and i loved the detail in the gold snaps/grommets.
Didn’t rock my world but worked!
These jeans were super comfortable and stretchy. Perfect for a nuuly customer who wants to have exciting clothes but can't commit to owning colored pants.

These jeans were crazy short on me hit halfway between my ankles and knees, and I'm only 5'10. Would not order if you're on the taller side. The color matches pictures perfectly though. I like the faded but still bright look.
I wore these to work A LOT! They look cute with black boots and a blouse or sweater. The fabric is a bit stretchy, and these jeans feel like a jegging.
Fit well. Cute color. Loved them!

These are wonderful and fit true to size! I was worried about the straight fit but they definitely hug a bit and give you great shape. I love Paige brand jeans and you can't go wrong with this gorgeous color!
These fit great! So stretchy and comfortable. I wore them multiple times and they didn't stretch out and still held their shape. 10/10 rental

links_reviews_title: Go to pants. Pink is the new black.
links_reviews_text: I’m usually a 26 but I got them in a 27 because I figured broken in jeans are a little more snug and they fit perfect. Or I just gained a little. Either way i love these pants and would wear them everyday.
These jeans looked so good on me. They fit every curve and have a lot of stretch but didn’t ever stretch out. These pants were so flattering I had a hard time giving them back.
There were super cute and fit well, but ultimately skewed a little too teen for me.

These added a colorful pink splash to lots of casual outfits for me. I’d purchase except my size is changing a lot right now so I’m not buying pants until I get settled. Comfortable, easy to care for, and really cute.
The color is very novel and pairs well with surprisingly many other color tops. I wore these a lot.

These were cute, just made me realize colored jeans aren't my style. Wore on Valentine's Day so it worked out that way. But that's just my personal preference. They fit great though and were incredibly flattering! Would have purchased if I had them in a standard denim color.
These are perfect. A perfect blush pink. Tight and hold you in, but with some stretch. They also held their shape for multiple wears. I regret sending them back. I'd probably be wearing them now.

links_reviews_title: They were cute in color and fabric I really liked, but I like more of a slim ankle fit and these are straight, as they say they are and a little shorter on me (5'7)
links_reviews_text: I paired them with a white button down on Valentines Day and a red Cardigan which actually was cute and brown booties.

They looked way cuter in the picture. On me, they were too long, not fitted enough, and looked shapeless, not in a good way. I wore them once just to get my money's worth but wanted to go home and change the whole time.

Really pretty, really soft, really great color. Perfect for wearing around the house with a tank and leggings (a.k.a. my new daily uniform). It's pretty heavy weight, but I live in a freezing cold basement and am always cold so I didn't mind - even renting in spring. The only thing off the mark for me, is that because of its weight, I wish it would have been a little shorter or even more of a high-low. Give me that and I would have bought this for sure.
i rented this as a cover up, to add a little something to plain outfits. it’s REALLY chunky. not quite what i imagined for summertime, but it works. just know it’s a bulky knit.
It's exactly what you think it is. An oversized cardigan sweater, perfect for layering up on chilly mornings. I loved it so much I bought it. Great color. Goes with everything.
Great material and fit! Super comfy and can be dressed up or down.
Wore this almost daily. Loved the oversized fit and cozy feel. It did tend to shed a lot and get caught on things, I wouldn't own it but loved wearing it!
This was not flattering on me and made me look like a linebacker, but it’s comfy and a great desk sweater.
casual enough for jeans but looked good dressed up too

Loved this sweater! Very cozy and casual. Didn’t wear it as much as I thought I would - guessing I would have had better off with the smaller size. But still loved the oversized look with blue jeans and white denim.

This was perfect for some rainy days had! Every time I wore it, I received compliments such as "omg I LOVE you sweater", " *reaches out to touch it* this is so cozy, I love that color." I would suggest this piece to anyone who needs a good layering piece.
Super soft, not itchy and pretty warm. A little roomy but that’s to be expected. Did leave little fuzzies around while I was wearing it. Thought about buying it! Lots of compliments
Tons of compliments on this perfectly peachy dream. I loved how it felt on my skin, and it looked great with most of my clothes. The fit was roomy and loose. The color was accurate to photos.

This sweater is really comfy, but it’s SUPER thick. The yarn is way thicker than I expected, so it was more like wearing a comfy blanket...but that was handy on cold days. It’s neutral so goes with everything. I did wear it a few times, because it’s just easy and really warm when it’s 30 degrees out.
Cute, but overall it was a little too chunky. Shoulders ended up fitting weird so I wore it only once.
A little oversized, but that's how it's intended. Cute and cozy!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous color but wrong fit for me
links_reviews_text: The color and fabric of this jacket are gorgeous! The fit is off for my body type (apple); fits through the shoulders, arms, and bust but not through the waist and hips. Tried to style it with a scarf but didn't wear out, the asymmetrical design highlighted fit issues. Big contrast between the sizing of this jacket and other jackets from the same brand.

Honestly, this a cute jacket, but the crushed velvet in the pink color looks borderline tacky... I really wanted to like it, but there's something about the material that feels cheap. Tried to wear a couple times, but just couldn't make it work.
worked great! Ordered a size up to wear with a sweater underneath. Would rent again 😍

links_reviews_title: loved it. it was unique and very comfy
links_reviews_text: loved it. it was unique and very comfy

I loved this jacket, however, I could have definitely gone with an Xtra small. I personally like these types of jackets to be form fitting, however this one was a little bit big. So cute though and will probably order again in an extra small.
So comfy, cute, soft, and such a fun statement piece. Adorable
I love this jacket. I should have ordered a small as it was a little tight in the shoulders but I did not let that stop me from wearing it. So darn cute
I love this jacket. Super cute color and fit. I am glad that I got a large since I have a broader back.
This is a perfect shirt for postpartum! So soft and flowy with cute details to make you feel dressed up. Wore with leggings and It covers your bum!

I love the material and flow of this Free People top. I wore it with jeans and wedges to dinner and a concert in NorCal. Very comfy but stylish. It's big, but that's the style. I would consider buying....

links_reviews_title: I felt like a goddess on vacation in my own home town
links_reviews_text: I wore it 5 months pregnant with jeans out and about in my cold home state. It's so great for an easy date night outfit.
SOmehow I missed that this had some clear sequins on it. So if you are not into that do not get.
i loved this top! It was simple and delicate, but it has some understated sequins in the embroidery that made it special! Loved this top.

links_reviews_title: My Favorite Nuuly Top So Far!
links_reviews_text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this top! It fit beautifully, it was casual but with the sequins it was SO fun to wear! I'm not sure whether the top comes in any colors other than white, but I expect before this month is over, I might find a new white sequined short in my closet!
Pretty top but proportions were way off. Definitely not made for larger chests
Just wasn't flattering on me.
Pretty, soft, rather sheer FP tunic. Lots of cute detailing. Very comfy. I liked it but didn't wear it because it seemed too springy. May order again in the future.
Very boho. A little sparkly so not work appropriate but enjoyed wearing it with jeans on the weekend. considering purchasing. could size down.
Seems fine but be aware that this shirt has sequins on it. I hate sequins so didn't like this.
Comfortable and lightweight. Only complaint is that it is a bit see through and I could see it stretching out after wearing it a few times.
There are sequins that are not shown in the picture of the shirt. So cute if it weren’t for that..
A beauty but very oversized. The sleeves draped over my hands and the overall length came down mid-thigh.
I loved it. My husband said I looked like I was dressed as a Barbie, but I choose to interpret that as a compliment.

This dress is so soft and lovely and the button details are beautiful. The wedding I rented this for was postponed so I floated around my apartment in this just to experience it. The ratio of fabric at the top of the sweater to that at the bottom is just a riddle. I think maybe if I was taller this might be a wee bit better...hrm...maybe paired with some black faux leather leggings and a high-boot...I don't know, I don't want to totally give up on this sweater, maybe you will come up with some cooler ideas of how to wear this.
